story.kicker_image_caption: Andy Murray has been in top form. (Reuters Photo)
story.storykicker: Andy Murray faces defending champion Stanislas Wawrinka in the semi-final of the French Open on Friday.
story.storybody:
Britain's Andy Murray has his best chance of winning the French Open this year, according to American great John McEnroe. (Also Read: Djokovic, Serena face overtime as finals beckon)

The second seed, who beat world number one Novak Djokovic to claim the Italian Open on clay in Rome last month, faces defending champion Stan Wawrinka in the semi-finals at Roland Garros later on Friday.

The 29-year-old Scot will be hoping to advance to the final for a first time after tasting semi-final defeat three times previously and with nine-times French Open champion Rafael Nadal out through injury, Murray's chances have greatly improved.

"Maybe Andy's best chance to win the French ever could be this year," said seven-times major winner McEnroe, who is working as a commentator in Paris.

"I don't know if he's going to be able to keep this up, so to me he has got his best shot ever.

"He has arguably been coming up against the three greatest guys who ever lived. So he has gotten a lot better and he can take pride in that. He can still add on a couple of majors.

"I think he is doing everything he can. I don't know him that well, certainly not enough to see his day-to-day. But Andy's had an incredibly consistent record in the slams."

Murray has won eight of his 15 encounters against Switzerland's Wawrinka.

Serbia's Djokovic, who like Murray has never won the French Open, takes on Austrian Dominic Thiem in the other semi-final on Friday.
story.magazinekicker: Andy Murray faces defending champion Stanislas Wawrinka in the semi-final of the French Open on Friday.
story.shortheadline: McEnroe believes Murray has best chance of winning French Open
story.storytitle: John McEnroe believes Andy Murray has best chance of winning French Open

story.strapheadline: Andy Murray can win French Open this year

briefcase_content.briefcase: Andy Murray is aiming for his maiden French Open crown.
He will face Wawrinka in the semi-final.
Murray has never went past semi-final at Roland Garros.
